newsitem.title: JAPAN: Indian rupee currently at right level - Chidambaram.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee currently at right level - Chidambaram.

text.p: Indian Finance Minister Palaniappan Chidambaram said on Sunday the rupee was currently at the right level and he saw no need for intervention.

Asked to comment on the view of some analysts that the rupee was overvalued and should be weakened, Chidambaram told Reuters Financial Television "No, I do not think we should induce a depreciation just to boost someone's confidence. Once you say the rupee will find its level in the market, then you must leave it to the market."
Chidambaram is in the southern Japanese city of Fukuoka to attend the annual meeting of the Asian Development Bank.

Asked about the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) stance on the rupee, Chidambaram said: "The RBI is not intervening indiscriminately. Within a band it allows the rupee to fluctuate and it's only when it goes beyond the band does the RBI intervene."
Foreign exchange inflows were strong and India had to find ways to use it.
"One way is to liberalise imports and if industry picks up as I expect it to, then there will be larger capital goods imports which will absorb much of that foreign exchange," he said.
"Only if it becomes volatile, then the bank should intervene. "Today I think the rupee has found its level and moves within a band.".
